description: Coined by  John Locke from Ancient Greek σημειωτικός (sēmeiōtikós, “fitted for marking, portending”), from σημειόω (sēmeióō, “to mark, interpret as a portend”), from σημεῖον (sēmeîon, “a mark, sign, token”), from σῆμα (sêma, “mark, sign”).

entries.meaning: The study of signs and symbols, especially as means of language or communication.
(dated) The study of medical signs and symptoms; symptomatology.
